intro: Iryanthera olacoides, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs. Iryanthera olacoides plays an important role in the ecosystem as a food source for various pollinators and animals.
